abstract: Earnings benefited from the reversal of about $1 billion that the nation’s biggest consumer bank had previously set aside to cover loan losses.
snippet: Earnings benefited from the reversal of about $1 billion that the nation’s biggest consumer bank had previously set aside to cover loan losses.
lead_paragraph: Wells Fargo, the nation’s biggest consumer bank, said profit rose 29 percent in the second quarter from the period a year earlier as loan losses eased significantly.

headline.main: Wells Fargo Exceeds Expectations With $3.9 Billion Profit, Up 29%
